page.title: 09William Emerson of Hurworth.
page.content: William Emerson was born in 1701. He was a mathematician and married the niece of the rector.The dowry was not paid so William took all of his wifes belongings, put them all in a wheel- barrow and dumped them on the rectors doorstep.Some people saw him as a magician because he knew a lot about the stars.He had a friend called John Hunter who was a brick layer.His favourite words were "thou fule thou". One day some professors went to his house to see if he could solve a problem.He gave it to John Hunter who did the sums on Williams hat. The professors were not satisfied because William did not look at it so they asked him to check it.He said it was perfectly right.William did not care how he dressed, his wigs were dirty and waistcoat buttoned at top and bottom only.He died in 1782.
